result.execSummary:
The defendant Roman Odell McClellan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid.  Defendant is placed on a payment plan of $50/month. First payment to be made on 03-01-2016 and on the 1st of each month until paid in full. Any missed payments and the entire amount becomes due and owing immediately to convert to a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank-surcharge IMPOSED.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and to establish paternity of his youngest child.
Court assessed NO fine.
With 5 days credit.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roman Odell McClellan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Roman Odell McClellan in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 5 days in the House of Correction, with 5 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and to establish paternity of his youngest child.
Court assessed no fine.
Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid.  Defendant is placed on a payment plan of $50/month.  First payment to be made on 3/1/2016 and on the 1st of each month until paid in full.  Any missed payments and the entire amount becomes due and owing immediately to convert to a civil judgment with tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Letter dated 8/11/205
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Status conference scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:

Defendant Roman Odell McClellan in court with Attorney Anthony Jackson.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case had been transferred to Branch 28 as part of a global resolution.
Defendant is requesting jury trial as to Case# 15CF002947.  As there is no longer a global resolution, parties request case be transferred back to Branch 21 Misdemeanor court.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 21, Reserve Judge.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Roman Odell McClellan in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's pending felony case set for trial.  On the day of trial, this matter should go back to misdemeanor court.

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Roman Odell McClellan not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant has a pending felony before Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Per the ADA and the clerk in Branch 21, Court ordered case transferred to Judge Brash, Branch 21 as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roman Odell McClellan in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has a pending felony case before Judge Brash (15CF002947). Defense request this case be transferred to Judge Brash's court to follow the felony case. The Court has no objection an authorize this case be transferred to Judge Brash's court only if the Judge accepts the transfer.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roman Odell McClellan in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
$400.00 bail to be returned. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roman Odell McClellan in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
